Create a fire-resistant barrier: By constructing a fire-resistant barrier around your home, you can the risk of a fire spreading to your house. This barrier can be made of materials such as brick, concrete, or fire-resistant drywall.
Install a sprinkler system: A sprinkler system can help to put out a fire before it spreads. You can install sprinklers in your home's attic, basement, and other areas where fires are known to start.

Keep a fire extinguisher handy: While sprinklers are effective in putting out small fires, a fire extinguisher can be used to put out larger fires. Make sure to keep a fire extinguisher handy in your home.
Create a fire escape plan: In case of a fire, having a fire escape plan in place can help you and your family to quickly and safely evacuate your home.

Learn how to start a fire: While it may seem counterintuitive, learning how to start a fire can actually help you to protect your home. This knowledge can be used to start a fire in a controlled manner, which can help to prevent it from spreading.
